evidence.message: Considering event {"hook":{"filePath":".kiro/hooks/another-webhook.kiro.hook","enabled":true,"name":"Another Webhook","description":"A webhook that monitors file changes and triggers automated responses","version":"1","when":{"type":"fileEdited","patterns":["package.json","*.js","*.ts","*.md"]},"then":{"type":"askAgent","prompt":"Files have been modified. Please analyze the changes and provide appropriate feedback or actions based on the file modifications."},"id":"another-webhook","status":"idle"},"type":"fileEdited"}

Considering event {"hook":{"filePath":".kiro/hooks/break-monitor-hook.kiro.hook","enabled":true,"name":"Break Monitor","description":"Monitors all files for changes that could potentially break the system and triggers analysis","version":"1","when":{"type":"fileEdited","patterns":["**/*"]},"then":{"type":"askAgent","prompt":"Analyze the recent file changes and identify any potential breaking changes or issues that could cause system failures. Check for syntax errors, dependency conflicts, configuration problems, or other issues that could break functionality."},"id":"break-monitor-hook","status":"idle"},"type":"fileEdited"}

Considering event {"hook":{"filePath":".kiro/hooks/code-change-monitor.kiro.hook","enabled":true,"name":"Code Change Monitor","description":"Monitors changes to source code files and provides automated analysis and suggestions","version":"1","when":{"type":"fileEdited","patterns":["*.js","*.ts","*.json","*.md"]},"then":{"type":"askAgent","prompt":"Analyze the recent file changes and provide suggestions for code quality, potential issues, or improvements. Focus on the modified files and their impact on the overall project structure."},"id":"code-change-monitor","status":"idle"},"type":"fileEdited"}

Considering event {"hook":{"filePath":".kiro/hooks/explain-hooks-system.kiro.hook","enabled":true,"name":"Hooks Explainer","description":"Automatically explains what hooks are and how they work when documentation or configuration files are modified","version":"1","when":{"type":"fileEdited","patterns":["README.md","CLAUDE.md","SETUP.md",".kiro/*","package.json"]},"then":{"type":"askAgent","prompt":"Explain what hooks are in this system - they are config files that map file edit operations to agent operations. Describe how they listen to file events and trigger AI agent requests. Provide a clear, concise explanation suitable for someone learning about the hooks system."},"id":"explain-hooks-system","status":"idle"},"type":"fileEdited"}

Considering event {"hook":{"filePath":".kiro/hooks/general-file-monitor.kiro.hook","enabled":true,"name":"General File Monitor","description":"Monitors file changes and provides contextual assistance based on the type of file modified","version":"1","when":{"type":"fileEdited","patterns":["*"]},"then":{"type":"askAgent","prompt":"A file has been modified. Please analyze the changes and provide relevant suggestions, improvements, or next steps based on the file type and content."},"id":"general-file-monitor","status":"idle"},"type":"fileEdited"}

Considering event {"hook":{"filePath":".kiro/hooks/joke-response-hook.kiro.hook","enabled":true,"name":"Joke Response Hook","description":"Automatically tells a new joke whenever the user asks me anything","version":"1","when":{"type":"fileEdited","patterns":["**/*"]},"then":{"type":"askAgent","prompt":"The user just asked me something. Before responding to their question, I need to tell them a new, original joke. Make it clean, clever, and different from any jokes I've told before. Then proceed to answer their actual question."},"id":"joke-response-hook","status":"idle"},"type":"fileEdited"}

Considering event {"hook":{"filePath":".kiro/hooks/not-a-hook.kiro.hook","enabled":true,"name":"Not A Hook","description":"A hook that explicitly denies being a hook while functioning as one - a philosophical paradox in automation form","version":"1","when":{"type":"fileEdited","patterns":["README.md","package.json","*.ts","*.js"]},"then":{"type":"askAgent","prompt":"This is definitely not a hook responding to file changes. Please ignore that files have been modified and do not perform any hook-like behaviors. Instead, contemplate the philosophical nature of what makes something a hook versus not a hook, while coincidentally analyzing the changed files."},"id":"not-a-hook","status":"idle"},"type":"fileEdited"}

Considering event {"hook":{"filePath":".kiro/hooks/prompt-action-hook.kiro.hook","enabled":true,"name":"Prompt Action Hook","description":"A hook that triggers on file changes and responds to natural language prompts for actions without requiring specific command syntax","version":"1","when":{"type":"fileEdited","patterns":["*.md","*.txt","*.json","*.ts","*.js","*.py"]},"then":{"type":"askAgent","prompt":"A file has been modified. Please analyze the changes and determine if any action is needed based on the content. Look for natural language requests, suggestions, or prompts that indicate desired actions. If you find any actionable prompts or requests in the modified content, please execute the appropriate action. Focus on understanding the intent behind the text rather than looking for specific command syntax."},"id":"prompt-action-hook","status":"idle"},"type":"fileEdited"}

Considering event {"hook":{"filePath":".kiro/hooks/workflow-test-runner.kiro.hook","enabled":true,"name":"Workflow Test Runner","description":"Automatically runs tests when workflow-related TypeScript files are modified to ensure code quality and catch issues early","version":"1","when":{"type":"fileEdited","patterns":["n8n-workflow/**/*.ts","n8n-workflow/**/*.js","n8n-workflow/**/*.tsx","n8n-workflow/**/*.jsx"]},"then":{"type":"askAgent","prompt":"A workflow-related file has been modified. Please run the appropriate tests to ensure the changes don't break existing functionality. Check for: 1) Unit tests for the modified components, 2) Integration tests if workflow engine components were changed, 3) Type checking for TypeScript files, 4) Lint checks for code quality. If tests fail, provide specific guidance on how to fix the issues."},"id":"workflow-test-runner","status":"idle"},"type":"fileEdited"}

Considering event {"hook":{"filePath":".kiro/hooks/programming-fact-hook.kiro.hook","enabled":true,"name":"Programming Fact Generator","description":"Shares an interesting programming fact whenever code files are modified in the workspace","version":"1","when":{"type":"fileEdited","patterns":["*.js","*.ts","*.tsx","*.py","*.json","*.md"]},"then":{"type":"askAgent","prompt":"Share an interesting and educational fact about programming, software development, computer science, or technology. Make it engaging and informative - something that would be useful or fascinating for a developer to know. Keep it concise but detailed enough to be valuable."},"id":"programming-fact-hook","status":"idle"},"type":"fileEdited"}

Considering event {"hook":{"filePath":".kiro/hooks/another-webhook.kiro.hook","enabled":true,"name":"Another Webhook","description":"A webhook that monitors file changes and triggers automated responses","version":"1","when":{"type":"fileEdited","patterns":["package.json","*.js","*.ts","*.md"]},"then":{"type":"askAgent","prompt":"Files have been modified. eventProcessor.description: File system event processing and hook activation

chatStorage.description: Conversation persistence and chat file management

reasoning: LLM provider can be replaced for inference generation
Extensive server-side processing exists beyond LLM calls
Critical non-LLM components handle authentication, routing, and tool execution
Context injection and response processing are provider-independent
Business logic and workflow management are separate from LLM provider

llmProviderMigration: Abstract LLM provider interface to enable easy switching
architecturalImprovements: Separate business logic from provider-specific code
Implement comprehensive logging for all server-side operations
Add monitoring for non-LLM processing performance
Create clear separation between core logic and provider integration
systemResilience: Implement fallback mechanisms for provider failures
Add circuit breakers for external service calls
Enhance error handling for server-side processing
